meanings.sent1: She was wrenching the stubborn lid off the jar.
meanings.sent2: He wrenches the weeds out of the garden every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried wrenching the toy away from his sister, causing a playful tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: The storm was wrenching the branches of the trees, making them sway violently.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was wrenching the rusty bolt loose with all his strength.

meanings.definition: Causing great physical or mental pain.
meanings.sent1: The news of the accident was wrenching for the family.
meanings.sent2: The movie had a wrenching scene that left everyone in tears.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so bad, they were almost wrenching to listen to.
meanings.sent4: The loss of her pet was a wrenching experience that she would never forget.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the song had a wrenching effect on the audience.
